com.montefiore.gaulthiergain.adhoclibrary.appframework

Class TransferManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.montefiore.gaulthiergain.adhoclibrary.appframework.TransferManager
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AutoTransferManager

    public class TransferManager
extends java.lang.Object

    This class provide high-Level APIs to manage ad hoc networks and communications.

        public void sendMessageTo(java.lang.Object message,
                          AdHocDevice adHocDevice)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          DeviceException
        Method allowing to send a message to a remote node represented by the adHocDevice parameter.
        Parameters:
        message - a generic object which represents the data to send through the network.
        adHocDevice - an AdHocDevice object which represents the remote peer to send message.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
        DeviceException - signals that a Device Exception exception has occurred.

      • broadcast

        public boolean broadcast(java.lang.Object message)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         DeviceException
        Method allowing to broadcast a message to all directly connected nodes.
        Parameters:
        message - a generic object which represents the data to send through the network.
        Returns:
        a boolean value which is true if message has been broadcasted to direct neighbors. Otherwise, false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
        DeviceException - signals that a Device Exception exception has occurred.

      • broadcastExcept

        public boolean broadcastExcept(java.lang.Object message,
                               AdHocDevice excludedDevice)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               DeviceException
        Method allowing to broadcast a message to all directly connected nodes.
        Parameters:
        message - a generic object which represents the data to send through the network.
        excludedDevice - a AdHocDevice object which represents the device that must be excluded during the broadcast process.
        Returns:
        a boolean value which is true if message has been broadcasted to direct neighbors. Otherwise, false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
        DeviceException - signals that a Device Exception exception has occurred.

      • connect

        public void connect(int attempts,
                    AdHocDevice adHocDevice)
             throws DeviceException
        Method allowing to connect to a remote peer represented by the adHocDevice parameter.
        Parameters:
        attempts - an integer value which represents the number of attempts to try to connect to the remote peer. Its initial default value is 1.
        adHocDevice - an AdHocDevice object which represents the remote peer to connect.
        Throws:
        DeviceException - signals that a Device Exception exception has occurred.

      • discovery

        public void discovery(DiscoveryListener discoveryListener)
               throws DeviceException
        Method allowing to perform a discovery depending the technology used. If the Bluetooth and Wi-Fi are enabled, the two discoveries are performed in parallel. A discovery stands for at least 10/12 seconds.
        Parameters:
        discoveryListener - a DiscoveryListener object which contains callback function.
        Throws:
        DeviceException - signals that a Device Exception exception has occurred.

      • getPairedBluetoothDevices

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,AdHocDevice> getPairedBluetoothDevices()
        Method allowing to get all the Bluetooth devices which are already paired.
        Returns:
        a HashMap object which contains all paired Bluetooth devices.

      • enableBluetooth

        public void enableBluetooth(int duration,
                            android.content.Context context,
                            ListenerAdapter listenerAdapter)
                     throws BluetoothBadDuration
        Method allowing to enable Bluetooth adapter.
        Parameters:
        duration - an integer value which is used to set up the time of the bluetooth discovery.
        context - a Context object which gives global information about an application environment.
        listenerAdapter - a ListenerAdapter object which contains callback functions.
        Throws:
        BluetoothBadDuration - signals that the duration for the bluetooth discovery is invalid.

      • setWifiGroupOwnerValue

        public void setWifiGroupOwnerValue(int valueGroupOwner)
                            throws GroupOwnerBadValue,
                                   DeviceException
        Method allowing to update the Group Owner value to influence the choice of the Group Owner negotiation.
        Parameters:
        valueGroupOwner - an integer value between 0 and 15 where 0 indicates the least inclination to be a group owner and 15 indicates the highest inclination to be a group owner. A value of -1 indicates the system can choose an appropriate value.
        Throws:
        GroupOwnerBadValue - signals that the value for the Group Owner intent is invalid.
        DeviceException - signals that a Device Exception exception has occurred.

      • removeWifiGroup

        public void removeWifiGroup(ListenerAction listenerAction)
                     throws DeviceException
        Method allowing to remove a current Wi-Fi group.
        Parameters:
        listenerAction - a ListenerAction object which contains callback functions.
        Throws:
        DeviceException - signals that a Device Exception exception has occurred.

      • isWifiGroupOwner

        public boolean isWifiGroupOwner()
                         throws DeviceException
        Method allowing to check if the current device is the Group Owner.
        Returns:
        a boolean value which is true if the current device is the Group Owner. Otherwise, false.
        Throws:
        DeviceException - signals that a Device Exception exception has occurred.

      • unpairBtDevice

        public void unpairBtDevice(AdHocDevice adHocDevice)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                           java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                           java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                           DeviceException
        Method allowing to un-pair a bluetooth device.
        Parameters:
        adHocDevice - a BluetoothAdHocDevice object which represents a remote Bluetooth device.
        Throws:
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - signals that a method does not exist.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - signals that an application tries to reflectively create an instance which has no access to the definition of the specified class
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - signals that a method does not exist.
        DeviceException - signals that a Device Exception exception has occurred.
